# Examples based on "Professor.csv" data

```{r}
library(car)
prof.data<-read.csv("professor.csv",stringsAsFactors = TRUE)
```

We can preview the relationship by conditional scatterplot
```{r}
scatterplot(data=prof.data,Salary~Exper|Gender)
```

We build three models in the slides

First model:
```{r}
model.1<-lm(data=prof.data,Salary~Exper+Gender)
summary(model.1)
```

Second model:
```{r}
model.2<-lm(data=prof.data,Salary~Exper+Gender:Exper)
summary(model.2)
```

Third model:
```{r}
# model.3 <-lm(data=prof.data, Salary~Exper+Gender+Gender:Exper)
model.3 <- lm(data=prof.data, Salary~Exper*Gender)
summary(model.3)
```
